techmeme.title: Despite OpenAI's move to shut out Chinese developers from its tech, OpenAI's models are still available in China via Microsoft's Azure China (The Information)
The FTC bans teen messaging app NGL from serving users under 18, a first; NGL agreed to pay $5M and stop marketing to kids and teens to settle the FTC lawsuit (Cristiano Lima-Strong/Washington Post)
NFT and metaverse content creation company Infinite Reality raised $350M at a $5.1B valuation and acquires Roblox game developer Landvault for $450M in stock (Dean Takahashi/VentureBeat)
Captions, which uses AI to let people create and edit videos, raised $60M led by Index Ventures at a $500M valuation, taking its total funding to $100M (Rachel Metz/Bloomberg)
Spotify adds the ability for users to leave comments on podcasts, expanding on polls and Q&As; comments will be private by default, and creators can opt out (Jay Peters/The Verge)
